result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald A. Kaleas was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald A. Kaleas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for jail credit
Order for Ignition interlock exemptions and removing title transfer stops

Defendant Gerald A. Kaleas in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter was set for Jury Trial today, however the matter is resolved.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1, OWI - 3rd offense.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed. 
Atty Gumz agrees.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend Ct. 1 to OWI - 3rd offense based on the motions filed.

Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1, OWI - 3rd offense.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz filed a reduced cost IID request and asks the court to grant that request.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, OWI - 3rd offense:  Court orders 50 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report forthwith; defendant is remanded into custody
*Huber to include employment and AODA treatment
*Pay fine and costs = $1,688.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*27 month DL Revocation 
*27 month Ignition Interlock (after the revocation)
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Credit to be determined by counsel by stipulation
bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on July 1, 2017

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Court will approve the 1/2 price IID request and signs the order.

Defendant Gerald A. Kaleas in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an amended criminal complaint was filed and also a motion was received by the defense today.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on November 12, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald A. Kaleas in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for a Motion and the Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Hendee states that in looking in the matter; the state moves to amend the charge to a OWI - 4th offense.
Atty Gumz agrees with the amendment and asks for a return be set.
BY THE COURT:  Charge will be amended to an OWI - 4th offense; Misd. charge.
Set for Return.
bond continued; will be a Misd. bond now.  Return date scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Mark J. Gumz by phone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests the motion reset as they may not need a hearing.  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Motion will be reset to September.  Will take up the issue of the motion if it still exists or handle the preliminary hearing at that time.
Atty Gumz requests consideration as to the conditions of the bond.  Atty Hendee responds.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will set the bond question over to the September hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.
LETTER FROM ATTY GUMZ REQUESTING PHONE APPEARANCE ON 8/15/14- COURT APPROVED
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Motion hearing on August 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Gerald A. Kaleas in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states defendant recently filed 2 motions and requests the preliminary hearing be rescheduled so he has time to review the motion.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz responds and understands the Courts questions; however, he has some concerns with the bond issue.  
BY THE COURT:  Court believes states request is appropriate.  Set motion and reset preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:45 am.
